qas.question: Which agency is in charge of health and wellness services in Hyderabad?

answers.text: Commissionerate of Health and Family Welfare

qas.question: How many government hospitals did Hyderabad have in 2010?
How many beds are available in all of Hyderabad's hospitals and nursing homes combined?
How many nurses per 10,000 persons are there in Hyderabad?
People choose to use what type of facility due to long distances and poor care at Government hospitals?

context: The <a0_0>Commissionerate of Health and Family Welfare<a0_0/> is responsible for planning, implementation and monitoring of all facilities related to health and preventive services. As of 2010[update]–11, the city had <a1_0>50<a1_0/> government hospitals, 300 private and charity hospitals and 194 nursing homes providing around <a2_0>12,000<a2_0/> hospital beds, fewer than half the required 25,000. For every 10,000 people in the city, there are 17.6 hospital beds, 9 specialist doctors, <a3_0>14 nurses<a3_0/> and 6 physicians. The city also has about 4,000 individual clinics and 500 medical diagnostic centres. <a4_0>Private clinics<a4_0/> are preferred by many residents because of the distance to, poor quality of care at and long waiting times in government facilities,:60–61 despite the high proportion of the city's residents being covered by government health insurance: 24% according to a National Family Health Survey in 2005.:41 As of 2012[update], many new private hospitals of various sizes were opened or being built. Hyderabad also has outpatient and inpatient facilities that use Unani, homeopathic and Ayurvedic treatments.
